content: On September 1, 1998, the Atlanta Braves achieved a historic milestone by clinching their seventh consecutive NL East title. This victory solidified their dominance in the division during the 1990s, with the team led by stars like Greg Maddux and Chipper Jones. The Braves celebrated this achievement in front of their home crowd at Turner Field, setting the stage for their postseason run that year, which ultimately culminated in a World Series appearance.
